pr_title: Allocate CPU quanta per query instead of per task

timeline.bodyText: let's not call this "legacy" since  such scheduling policy might be reasonable for interactive workload . Maybe just a enum about "TASK_FAIR" vs. "QUERY_FAIR" , tuned for interactive/batch use case :)
timeline.author: wenleix

timeline.bodyText: Wait how can this be a session property? -- what about some query claims "TASK_FAIR" scheduling while some other query claim "QUERY_FAIR"? It looks like more like a cluster-level global config (e.g. configuration property)
timeline.author: wenleix

timeline.message:
Allocate CPU quanta per query instead of per task

Allows to optionally enabled fair CPU allocation per query

Allocate CPU quanta per query instead of per task

Allows to optionally enabled fair CPU allocation per query

replies.bodyText: It keeps track of the task priority.
replies.author: arhimondr

timeline.bodyText:
nit:
                LoadingCache<QueryId, TaskPriorityTracker> cache = CacheBuilder.newBuilder()
                        .weakValues()

timeline.author: wenleix

timeline.bodyText: I am thinking if we should actually have a constructor that takes Function<QueryId, TaskPriorityTracker> as parameter?
timeline.author: wenleix
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -185,6 +225,7 @@ public TaskExecutor(
             int minDrivers,
             int guaranteedNumberOfDriversPerTask,
             int maximumNumberOfDriversPerTask,
+            TaskPriorityTracking taskPriorityTracking,

replies.bodyText: It feels like priority tracking should be an implementation detail of the TaskExecutor. I don't mind exposing it if it is ever actually needed though. Since now it is not needed - i would prefer keeping it as is.
replies.author: arhimondr
